document.text:
From: White Collar Law360 <news-alt@law360.com> 
To: 
Subject: Ex-Braskem Exec Granted S30M Bail In Bribery Case 
Date: Fri, 13 Dec 2019 09:13:45 +0000 
;law360 White 
Collar 
WHITE COLLAR 
Friday, December 13, 2019 Law360 
TOP NEWS 
Ex-Braskem Exec Granted $30M Bail In Bribery Case 
The former CEO of Brazilian oil company Braskem satisfied a reluctant 
magistrate judge on Thursday that cash and investments worth about $30 
million, or around half his wealth, will be enough to ensure he appears in 
Brooklyn to face charges of conspiring to bribe officials in his home country. 
Read full article » 
House Panel Subpoena For Trump Docs Invalid, Justices Told 
A House committees subpoena for President Donald Trump's financial 
records should be invalidated because the request was made outside 
Congress' authority and poses constitutional concerns that warrant review by 
the U.S. Supreme Court, Trump's attorneys told the court Thursday. 
Brief attached I Read full article )› 
HP Accuses Autonomy CEO Of Repeated Lies At Trial 
Autonomy founder Mike Lynch repeatedly lied in his retelling of events 
leading up to Hewlett-Packard's ill-fated acquisition of his software firm, HP's 
lawyer told a London judge as the trial over the technology giant's $5 billion 
fraud claim wound down Thursday. 
Read full article » 
10 Former NFL Players Charged In Medical Benefits Fraud 
Ten former NFL players including ex-Washington Redskins running back 
Clinton Fortis have been indicted in Kentucky federal court on charges they 
defrauded an NFL health plan out of more than $3.4 million. 
2 documents attached 
I 
Read 
full article 
» 
Feds Say 'Varsity Blues' Dad Isn't Being Denied Evidence 
A former casino executive has all he needs to defend himself against charges 
he bribed his daughter's way into college, federal prosecutors said 
Wednesday as they pushed back against a claim that they are withholding 
FBI reports that could help show his innocence in the "Varsity Blues" case. 
document attached I 
Read 
full 
article » 
MVP: Kaplan Hecker's Sean Hecker 
Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP's Sean Hecker earned a rare acquittal of market 
manipulation allegations against a Barclays trader, and he's helped build a 
robust white collar practice at his emerging boutique firm, earning him a spot 
as one of Law360's 2019 White Collar MVPs. 
Read full article » 
,Law360 Pro Say Podcast 
Listen to our new podcast here

SECURITIES 
Shopin CEO Cops To $42.5M Fraudulent Crypto Offering 
The CEO of online retail platform Shopin pled guilty to securities fraud for a 
cryptocurrency scheme in which he lied to investors about the company and 
held a $42.5 million unregistered initial coin offering, the New York attorney 
general's office announced Thursday. 
Read full article » 
Rabobank Sues Ex-Trader For Exit Package Over Libor Fight 
Rabobank has demanded that a former trader repay a £119,000 ($157,000) 
exit package that he allegedly violated by suing the Dutch lender for not 
coming to his defense when U.S. prosecutors charged him with rigging a key 
benchmark interest rate. 
Read full article » 
LEGAL ETHICS 
Exonerated Texas Judge Fights For Spot On 2020 Ballot 
A former Texas state judge who was exonerated of bribery and money 
laundering convictions in 2017 is looking to the state's highest court for help 
to get on the March 2020 primary ballot. 
Petition 
attached I Read full 
article 
» 
Ex-Court Worker Gets 2 Years For Lying In Pay-To-Play Probe 
An Illinois federal judge on Thursday gave a former associate clerk with the 
Cook County Circuit Court two years in prison for lying to a grand jury, saying 
if people believe they are above the rule of law, "the entire foundation of our 
democracy grinds to a halt." 
Read full article » 
HEALTH 
Judge Urges Gov't, Esformes To Work Out Atty Fee Deal 
A Florida federal judge on Thursday urged prosecutors and attorneys for 
convicted nursing home mogul Philip Esformes to work together on an 
agreement to unfreeze certain assets to cover millions in unpaid legal bills 
from Esformes' trial to avoid a complicated legal battle over what fee amount 
is reasonable. 
Read full 
article 
» 
GOVERNMENT CONTRACTS 
Biz Manager Gets 21/2  Years Over $2.2M DOD Parts Scam 
A California man was sentenced to 2% years in federal prison for his part in a 
scheme to sell the U.S. Department of Defense $2.2 million worth of 
defective parts for military weapons systems, the U.S. District Attorneys 
Office for the Southern District of Ohio announced Thursday. 
Read full article » 
TAX 
Businessmen Can't Quash Citi Subpoena In Tax Privacy Case 
Two Texas businessmen cannot quash a government subpoena seeking 
clarification on whether Citibank possessed their tax information because it 
may shed light on their suit alleging the information was unlawfully disclosed 
by the IRS, a South Dakota federal court ruled. 
Order attached I Read 
full article »

SPORTS & BETTING 
NFL Players Union Accused Of Harassing Agent 
An NFL player agent is suing the NFL Players Association for $2.8 million, 
claiming he's lost all his clients and future prospects after the association 
harassed him and wined his reputation over criminal charges that were 
dismissed. 
1 document attached I Read full article » 
CONSUMER PROTECTION 
Pa. AG, Temple Reach Deal On Online MBA Rating Inflation 
Pennsylvania Attorney General Josh Shapiro announced on Thursday that 
Philadelphia-based Temple University had signed a deal to resolve claims the 
university's business school knowingly used false data to boost the rankings 
of its online MBA program. 
Read full article » 
LEGAL INDUSTRY 
Boies Schiller Names New Generation Of Leaders 
Legal powerhouse Boies Schiller Flexner LLP has put forward two partners to 
potentially take over the firm from its founders, including famous litigator 
David Boies, the firm confirmed on Thursday. 
Read full article » 
Tesla's 3rd General Counsel In A Year Leaves Automaker 
In yet another general counsel shakeup this year, Tesla Inc.'s top lawyer and 
a longtime insider has left the electric automaker after just 10 months in the 
role, moving on to lead the legal team at an artificial intelligence company, 
the startup announced Thursday. 
Read full article » 
Latham & Watkins Launches Free Onsite Health Clinic 
Latham & Watkins LLP has opened an onsite clinic at its downtown Los 
Angeles office, which offers both physical and mental health care options for 
free to employees, the firm announced on Thursday. 
Read full article » 
3 Tips For Women Who Want To Argue At The Supreme Court 
Women should think outside the billable-hour box and assert themselves 
more to land opportunities to argue before the U.S. Supreme Court, 
according to members of a panel who discussed the issue Thursday in 
Chicago. 
Read full article » 
Hotelier Seeks $28M Deal Outside LeClairRyan's Ch. 7 
A Virginia hotel operator and former LeClairRyan PLLC client wants out of the 
automatic stay in the defunct firm's bankruptcy proceedings so it can go after 
LeClairRyan for S28 million and resolve a malpractice suit lodged before the 
bankruptcy, according to a motion filed Thursday. 
Read full article » 
Wis. Bar Dodges 1st Amendment Fight Over Mandatory Dues 
A Wisconsin federal judge has tossed a lawsuit by two lawyers who objected 
to paying dues to the state's bar association, the latest case where attorneys 
are challenging the requirement on First Amendment grounds. 
Read full article »

Law360's Weekly Verdict: Legal Lions & Lambs 
Paul Weiss locked down a spot on the legal lions list this week with a 
favorable decision for ExxonMobil in a landmark climate change-related 
investor fraud case, while a $20 million verdict against Greyhound landed 
Lewis Brisbois on the week's legal lambs list. 
Read full article » 
Podcast 
Law360's The Term: The Gov't May Owe ACA Insurers Billions 
On this week's episode of Law360's The Term, the team dives into the high 
court's latest Affordable Care Act case: a $12 billion fight between the 
government and health insurers. 
Read full article »
